intro: Schizoglossum bidens subsp. atrorubens, commonly known as the red-stemmed spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The subspecies is distinguished by its dark red stems and yellowish-green leaves with prominent veins. It typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
